class simulate_trace.make_pulse.PolynomialPhase(central_frequency: float | int | None, coefficients: ndarray | tuple | float | int)

Bases: SpectralPhase

Coefficients are for all taylor-orders -> for a third order pulse, zeros have to be present for the other orders.

central_frequency: float | int | None
coefficients: ndarray | tuple | float | int

class simulate_trace.make_pulse.MakePulse(N=256, Delta_f=None)

Bases: object

Is supposed to generate pulses based on input parameters from GaussianAmplitude, PolynomialPhase, SinusoidalPhase, RandomPhase, CustomPulse or MultiPulse.

N

the number of points on the time/frequency-grid

Type:

int

Delta_f

the frequency range which is used. Extends from -Delta_f to +Delta_f (so it should actually be named f_max?)

Type:

float

gaussian(x, amp, fwhm, shift, p)
lorentzian(x, amp, fwhm, shift, p)

class simulate_trace.make_trace.MakePulse(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: MakePulse

Simulates measurement traces based in input pulses. Inherits from make_pulse.MakePulse.

maketrace
Type:

None, MakeTraceFROG, MakeTraceCHIRPSCAN, MakeTrace2DSI, MakeTraceTDP, or MakeTraceVAMPIRE

generate_frog(time, frequency, pulse_t, pulse_f, nonlinear_method, cross_correlation=False, ifrog=False, gate=(None, None), real_fields=False, frequency_range=None, N=256, cut_off_val=0.001, interpolate_fft_conform=False, scale_time_range=1, plot_stuff=True)

Generates a FROG trace using the provide pulse/gate.

Parameters:

time

:param : :param frequency: :param : :param pulse_t: :param pulse_f: :param nonlinear_method: :param : :param cross_correlation: :param : :param ifrog: :param : :param gate: :param : :param real_fields: :param : :param frequency_range: :param : :param N: :param : :param cut_off_val: :param : :param interpolate_fft_conform: :param : :param scale_time_range: :param : :param plot_stuff: :param :

Returns:

tuple[jnp.array, jnp.array, jnp.array, Pytree], the time and frequency axis, the trace, the spectra
